Name: Battle-axe
Description: Characteristic of the weapons of the Hyksos are their bronze battle-axes. This type of weapon was not known in Egypt. The Egyptians used axes with a flat broad blade. The slender battle-axe of the Hyksos is hexagonal in cross-section and has a loop at the end of the shaft with hooks pointing up and down. The edges of the loop end in a rim. Such battle-axes are found in tombs, usually close to the head or chest of the deceased.
